import React from 'react'; import './Inventory.css'; export default function Inventory() { return (

Inventory Management

Inventory Categories:

  • Milk
  • Cheese
  • Yogurt
  • Butter

Tracking System:

Our inventory is tracked using a barcode system. Each product is assigned a unique barcode which is scanned when it is received, sold, or returned. This allows us to track the movement of each product in real-time and update inventory levels accordingly.

Demand Forecasting:

We use demand forecasting algorithms to predict how much inventory is needed at any given time. These algorithms use historical sales data, seasonality, and other factors to make predictions about future demand. By using these algorithms, we can ensure that we always have enough inventory to meet customer demand without overstocking.

Low Inventory Alerts:

We have set up alerts that notify us when inventory levels fall below a certain threshold. This allows us to restock inventory before it runs out, which helps ensure that customers always have access to the products they need.

Expiration Tracking:

We track expiration dates and product quality using a first-in, first-out (FIFO) system. This means that the oldest products are sold or used first. We also implement quality control checks to ensure that products meet our standards for freshness and quality.

) }
